ratings.comment: I'm so saddened to see such negative reviews of Steve. I had him two years ago for micro101, and although the exams were challenging, he was extremely willing to help students understand it. If you go to office hours or the optional discussions, you'll get so much more out of the class.

Steve is a very loving and gentle professor who cares about his students. It is helpful to go to his office hours. However, even with the above, microbio 101 is an extremely difficult class. You need to memorize and start early. He offers 5 exams but you can only take 4. I recommend taking the first so you're prepared and can "gauge" the class.

Do not take this course with this professor. He is a very nice person and helpful if you come to office hours, but lectures are useless to go to, exams are hard (will expect you to know the slightest details) and this course surely does not feel like 101 level. It will lower your GPA.

Not the best professor. He gives you powerpoint slides and lecture summaries, which are useful. Records his lectures so you hardly have to go to class. Tests are pure memorization and applications, which he doesn't teach in class. Not the best at explaining things simply. Don't take if you haven't had bio before.

not the greatest teacher i've ever had. lectures are pretty scattered and exams can be tough since he doens't always teach everything on them and there is no textbook. if you don't a signifcant bio background don't take him

Barclay is a very nice guy and he's helpful in person, but this class is terrible. You get to learn about interesting things, but Barclay makes it about pure memorization and will literally at times show you a list and tell you to memorize everything on it. Cool content, but Barclay just kills it. Luckily, he's a nice guy and will happily help you.

Lectures dont make any sense. He just rambles on and nothing becomes clear. He clearly doesnt understand that it is a 100 level course because it is assumed that many things are known previous to taking the class. I suggest you take zoology before this class. Or just take another professor!

It is definitely not necessary to go to class. Very hard to pay attention during lecture as he seems to just ramble on. Read the lecture summaries and powerpoint slides, and go over old exam questions and you'll do find on the exams. Not a hard class, but you will need to prepare for the exams.

Steve is a great guy and the material gets a ton more interesting by the end of the semester. If you go in for office hours he will patiently explain anything you don't understand!! As long as you put in effort he really wants you to succeed. I really enjoyed the class.

Barclay was a very nice guy but not a very good lecturer, pretty awkward.  The exams weren't hard, just tricky.  Nothing is really a surprise, but definitely don't buy the book, it's expensive and you won't use it once.

Barclay is such a nice guy. His lectures are very boring, but he tells you exactly what you need to know. Buy the lecture summaries and lecture slides from Bob's Copy Shop. Everything is directly off of those. Focus on lecture summaries and past exams (they come together). Overall you need to put effort into the class
hard material not explained well.no curve. nice prof. im a good student, but you seriously wont open the book.its not required

He's a very nice guy and you can tell he genuinely cares that students understand the info, but he's just not the most charismatic professor. Definitely go to class and study the lecture outlines, if you can get the old exams from someone, definitely do because most questions are re-used or very similar. Not a bad class overall.

Barclay was a very fair professor.  Although his lectures were drier than toast on Sunday morning, still get at least something lecture.  Tests are challenging but similar to past exams (but not the same!).  If taken Bio 151/152 this class is fairly easy.

This is def a class you will have to teach most of the material to yourself. Going to lecture is a waste of time if you don't understand the concepts before hand. His teaching style is not conducive to people w/o a previous background in biology. I really wish CALS would find someone else to teach this class.

Overall, this should not be a 100 level course the way he teaches it and the amount of information you need to know. I like the guy but it's useless to go to lecture b/c u get nothing from it. Also, he found out mid-semester that people were using previous exams to study so he completely changed them. So, don't just rely on old exams anymore!

This is one of the most boring classes i have ever taken. The professor knows his material but donen't have a clue to how present it in a 100 level way. Extremely dull and the grading scale is ridiculous and ruins GPAs. Do not take this class unless you abolutely have to.

I try really hard to pay attention, but this class is sooo boring!  He seems to know what he's talking about, but has no idea how to explain it to students in a 100 level course...this class should definitely be a higher level. Exams are very tricky and more detailed than the practice exams
He's hard to understand at times and seems to be a little absent minded.

If you know everything in the lecture summaries, exams are pretty easy. He wasn't the best lecturer, but I still liked him. He obviously really likes microbio and gave interesting extra info. He was also very clear on what would be important on the exams. No final!

This class is TERRIBLE.  Barclay is a HORRIBLE professor and this class is meant to ruin your GPA, no joke.  This should DEFINITELY be higher than a 100 level class, or have someone else teach it.  Past exams are used to study, but exams are trickier than heck.  Its a shame he's the only prof for this course and its a requirement for so many majors

Get the old exams, they are identical.   didn't find him at all confusing or difficult to understand.  And all the lecs are recorded, so i maybe went to 7 lecs all semester and easily got an a.  really great guy.

Prof Barclay's class was difficult, but if you are willing to put in a little work, it's not terrible.  I went into office hours a lot, and he was EXTREMELY helpful and patient.  I found him willing to clarify any concepts not easily understood.  I enjoyed the class.

Wost prof ever!!!!  Doesn't matter how much you study, you can't do well on the exam.  I can't believe it is only a 100 level course becuase he talkes to us as if we already know everything.  He uses ablsolutely no visual aids, just his horrible drawings.  This class is a good way to ruin your gpa.
If you can get old exams, do it! They are very helpful. Also meet with him. He's very nice and is good at answering questions one-on-one.
The questions on exams are so picky/obscure.  first exam I got a c, then found a test from last semster, which was the same exam he gave this semeser and got an a.  not a fair way to run a class.

Tests are ridiculous; I wouldn't have known the answers no matter how much I studied the notes.  Lectures are pretty boring and it's hard to get much out of them.  The material itself wouldn't be bad, though, if it were taught well.
Simply a great guy... Also, he only gave out takehome exams.

Worst professor I have had yet at this university. Exams are way too difficult for a 100-level course. He must believe he is lecturing to grad students, because he assumes we already have degrees in this material, judging by his teaching style. He told me flat-out that the only people who receive A's are those that have seen this material before.
Buddy up for this class, you'll need someone to study with after each lecture to decipher what exactly you were learning for 50 minutes.

Glad I took this class pass fail my senior year- the lamest prof i have had here.  The entire class slept through his lectures while he droned on in a monotone fashion.  His exams were difficult considering it was a 100 level class.  If you want to take bact take 303; ive seen those exams and they are 10 times easier.

I thought that the tests were really hard and confusing. Lectures weren't too bad... but make sure you buy his notes- I made the mistake of trying to save money and not buying them... but I didn't do well on the first test. Just buy them.

He is a really nice professor and provides great printed notes and powerpoints.  They are all you really need for the exams.  In lecture he may be a little unclear, but his printed notes clarify things.  He really likes to help people, too.  He even has phone conferences for discussions sometimes.

He's actually really nice and makes accomodations for discussion times when needed. Although he frequently goes into a bit too much detail, he doesn't test on things he says he won't. And if it's still a bad time, there are great tutors at GUTS.

He's really not as bad as the other posts are saying.  There's a secret to this class that I didn't figure out until halfway through - KNOW THE PRACTICE EXAMS.  There, I gave it away.  He's a good guy, and he can be generous with grades (i.e. bump you up if you need it).
definately a horrible professor. no doubt he's a very smart man, just can't teach AT ALL. I still pulled off an AB, just do the practice exams
It's not that hard and it's not that boring. He knows what he's talking about.

Probably the worst professor ever.  The class is easy, but his tests are strictly based on memorizing pointless crap he mentions in passing.  If you have a really good memory you'll be fine, otherwise, take 303, I heard that guy is a lot better.
The guy seems dumb, and is a horrible lecturer.  He is so boring.  Do not buy the book it is such a waste of money.

Sometimes he is unclear in lecture, but just take notes in class (even if you do not understand them at first), read the lecture notes a couple of times, and do the old exams and you will be fine. The material isn't that hard and the exams are more memorizations than comprehension.

He seems like a very nice guy, but is still somewhat clueless on how to give a lecture. He does an alright job (if you get the lecture power points and summaries). Overall, a very easy class and pretty interesting as well.

His droning monotonous voice puts me to sleep every time. He makes the subject matter much harder and less interesting than it should be. Study the old exams more than half the questions will be the same.

This was one of the most boring classes I've taking at this university.  He was a knowledgable prof. but was bad at presenting it.  The tests were very hard, even after studying for hours.  I hated it.
This guy is rip-out-your-hair boring.  His tests include a lot more information than a 101 class should.  Take 303 and learn something.
His lectures were quite boring, but tolerable. It's the exams that I hated. He'd always have the most ambiguous questions.

nice guy, always available for help and review sessions. teaches from power point which makes lectures a bit boring/not totally mandatory... if you study and know the material from his lecture review packet exams are pretty easy.

he is always willing to hold review sessions or meet with you outside of lecture times.  He does not teach from a text book but he does make his powerpoints and lecture summaries available.  He definately makes sure that you know the material and are able to apply it.  Highly recommended!

I liked him a lot. He may not be the most interesting speaker, but he genuinely enjoys bacteriology and is very knowledgeable. His tests may be a little on the hard side, but his curves are fair. His review sections are very helpful. He wants to help you to do well in his class. Nice guy.
He is VERY boring to listen to and cannot explain anything! He asked my class to please help him explain ideas better.

unbelievably difficult tests, very very tricky multiple choice.  i'd study for hours on end and he'd still pick out some little concept.  he teaches from power point, no text.  very hard to keep awake in lecture. worst class i've taken at this university.
Doesn't explain anything
No Comments

Teaches off powerpoints, dry speaker.  Very knowledgeable researcher, answers questions in weekly review sessions(very helpful!).  Tests are MC, he tells you what you need to know for them.  No required text, but material is clearer if you read from one.

Ok people. The left side of my face was so red after a semister with him. I had to Slap myself awake after every lecture. I always had the appearance he was like the Dry Eye, Clear spokesman. If you take any classes with him, then you should be here.
very stupidly hard tests, boring lectures and overall just a bad class. i'd say don't take it, but it's usually only taken as a requirement, so good luck to you all
WORST TEACHER EVER!  doesn't know the answers to his own test questions, lies and says it is correct, avoid him at all costs

(Bacteriology 101 in Microbio. dept.)  Helpful if you seek it out, has to work w/o TAs, information as clear as can be expected in a complicated subject, lectures aren't too bad.  1st exam ok, progressively harder. Just very complex subject.
